result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianne Lee Sandoval was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brianne Lee Sandoval is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brianne Lee Sandoval was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Kirk Anderson   DF:  Brianne Lee Sandoval appeared. Case called at 1:53 p.m. ADA Nieskes gives recites recommendation. Atty Anderson confirms agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 Uttering a Forgery in 15CF363 . DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Uttering a Forgery in 15CF363. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1       in 15CF363. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- 34 days jail. Credit for 34 days. TIME SERVED

- Court Costs and DNA Surcharge. BOND TO APPLY. Any remaining amount owed is to be paid within 60 days

- DNA Sample
Plea hearing at 02-03-2016 01:45 pm

Preliminary hearing at 08-14-2015 09:30 am

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Michael H. or the Kwik Trip in Hudson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
